result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mookie Montel Matthews

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mookie Montel Matthews in court.  Attorney Ashley Fard in court for Mookie Montel Matthews.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Final Pre-Trial. In chambers discussion placed on the record.  Defense objects to Court adjourning this matter and motions to exclude lab reports and testimony of lab analyst at trial.  For the reasons stated on the record, the motion is DENIED.  The Court finds good cause to VACATE the Jury Trial set for 10/10/2022 and adjourns this matter to allow time for the parties to seek alternative resolutions, review lab results and/or file any Daubert motions.  Case adjourned to Br 9 for Scheduling conference.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion to Extend Plea Paperwork, filed.

Defendant Mookie Montel Matthews in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Defendant Mookie Montel Matthews in custody.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  State to file crime lab analysist.  Defense does not have offer from state.  Defendant requested speedy trial demand during preliminary hearing; signature bond was set, defendant is not in custody for this case.  Case scheduled for IN PERSON final pretrial and jury trial.  Court scheduled deadline for state to turnover discovery, with the exception of crime lab reports by July 25, 2022; state has deadline to have crime labs submitted and completed by September 19, 2022.  Court scheduled deadline to file any motions by August 8, 2022, and scheduled deadline to file plea forms and jury trial documents by October 3, 2022.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. 10/11/2022

Defendant Mookie Montel Matthews in court with Attorney Ashley Fard.  Defendant Mookie Montel Matthews in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Terrell. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17. Next date provided by the clerk in Br. 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Defendant Mookie Montel Matthews in court, appear by video with attorney Ashley Fard, appear by video.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness not present. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Mookie Montel Matthews in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Mookie Montel Matthews in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mookie Montel Matthews appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
